subject: History
title: The Nutmeg Wars
description: A 60-second lesson on The Nutmeg Wars.

hook.text: In the 1600s, the Dutch massacred nearly an entire island's population to control one spice: nutmeg.

buildup.text: Nutmeg grew only on the Banda Islands in Indonesia. It was worth more per ounce than gold in Europe.

discovery.text: The Dutch East India Company demanded a monopoly. When the Bandanese resisted, the VOC sent soldiers.

twist.text: In the Treaty of Breda (1667), the Dutch traded Manhattan to England for a nutmeg islandâ€”Run Island.

climax.text: New York exists partly because the Dutch valued a tiny spice island more than all of Manhattan.

punchline.text: New York was traded for a bag of nutmeg.

quiz.question: What did the Dutch trade to England in exchange for the nutmeg island of Run?
